title: In Arbery Murder Trial, Defendant Travis McMichael Takes the Stand
sub_head: Defendant tells jury his Georgia neighborhood had seen a rise in thefts
body:
Travis McMichael, one of the men accused of killing Ahmaud Arbery, took the stand in his defense Wednesday, stating his neighborhood had seen a sharp increase in crime, including an incident days before the shooting in which a man trespassing on a neighbor’s property appeared to be armed and had threatened him.
Mr. McMichael, 35 years old, is accused of chasing Mr. Arbery with his father, Gregory McMichael, 65, and William “Roddie” Bryan Jr., 52, in two pickup trucks. Travis McMichael had an altercation with Mr. Arbery and shot him three times with a 12-gauge shotgun, according to court records and video of the incident. The three men face charges including felony murder and aggravated assault.
